page.title: 17 SANDLING PARK.
page.content: The estate was bought by the Hardy family in 1897 and is now run by Major Hardy. The garden is open on the four Sundays in May and the first one in June from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. The garden covers approximately 12 acres and the main flowers are rhododendrons, azaleas and primulas. There are also many trees and flowering shrubs. There is free parking and a small garden shop. All the money goes to the National Garden Scheme. The gardens have been open to the public since 1920 and has thousands of visitors a year.
